table.caption: Table 108 — Font types
head: Type
Subtype Value
Description
rows: (PDF 1.2) A composite font — a font composed of glyphs from a descendant CIDFont (see 9.7, "Composite fonts")
A font that defines glyph shapes using Type 1 font technology (see 9.6.2, "Type 1 fonts").
A multiple master font — an extension of the Type 1 font that allows the generation of a wide variety of typeface styles from a single font (see 9.6.2.3, "Multiple master fonts")
A font that defines glyphs with streams of PDF graphics operators (see 9.6.4, "Type 3 fonts")
A font based on the TrueType font format (see 9.6.3, "TrueType fonts") and with glyph descriptions based on TrueType glyph technology.
(PDF 1.2) A CIDFont whose glyph descriptions are based on CFF font technology (see 9.7.4, "CIDFonts")
(PDF 1.2) A CIDFont whose glyph descriptions are based on TrueType glyph technology (see 9.7.4, "CIDFonts")
